do you share your tiddlywiki(s) with oth: No, but I may export content into other formats and share individual tiddlers, the whole wiki, or an extract of the wiki
putting it all together, what value does: A great deal of value: it is my main store of information, and a key thinking tool I use at least most days.
what is your level of ability with tiddl: I have customised TiddlyWiki through options and plugins;I am comfortable using WikiText widgets (e.g. <$transclude>, <$list>...);I am comfortable writing filter expressions;I have written custom HTML;I have written custom CSS styles
how do you save changes in tiddlywiki?: Single-file wiki with custom saver (e.g. TiddlyPWA, Timimi, tw5-browser-nativesaver);Multi-file wiki served through Node.js
how do you back up/sync changes between: Consumer online storage (e.g. Google Drive, Dropbox);DIY (any other solution)

outside of plugins, palettes and other i:
- quite heavily adapted Projectify plugin for more helpful project management for me
- adapted Gruvbox dark palette (more accessible code colours and some other minor differences
- custom CSS 
- adapted RefNotes and BibTex importer plugins
what are we doing well? prompts for thin:
- Super helpful community on talk.tiddlywiki
- Regular updates and information about possible future updates
- I pure love wikitext syntax for formatting text etc.
- runs in a browser
- it's a Quine
- incredibly adaptable 
- very powerful wikitext (language)
what could we do better? prompts for thi:
- I wish I were better able to grasp key aspects of widgets / parameters / functions from the official documentation (e.g., I have been making a new project manager for about 2 years and still haven't finished it, in part because I don't fully understand what I am doing, or what could work best)
- I am worried my main wiki is starting to slow slightly as it grows (currently >20Mb in size, just from text notes, SVG icons, etc.) and would like it to be able to easily handle far larger sizes
with your consent, we would like to publ: Yes, I am happy for my responses to be published
